sentences: Derek Boland (15 January 1965 â€“ 15 November 2009), better known by his stage name Derek B, was a British rapper.
His most commercially successful releases were "Goodgroove" and "Bad Young Brother" in 1988.
Born in Hammersmith, London, to Trinidadian nurse Jenny Boland, he was raised in Woodford.
When a planned compilation of US hip hop called Def Beats 1 (Music of Life, 1986) ran short of tracks, Boland stepped in to record a track called "Rock the Beat".
He received criticism for rapping under an assumed American accent, something which was popular in the early days of British hip-hop, but later abandoned by some artists.
Following his chart success, Derek B was signed up to Rush Artist Management and released singles and the album, Bullet From a Gun (Tuff Audio, 1988).
In 1988, he also helped to write the Liverpool F.C. anthem, "Anfield Rap".
He died of a heart attack in London on 15 November 2009, aged 44.
